ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you engaged in any gambling in the last 12 months? Gambling includes playing cards for money; betting on horses, dogs, or other animals; betting on sports of any kind; playing dice games, including craps, over and under or other dice games; gambling at casinos (legal or otherwise); playing lotteries or bingo for money; playing slot machines, poker machines, or other gambling machines; playing games of skill for money (e.g., bowling, pool, golf); playing pull tabs or paper games other than lotteries
Thinking about the last 12 months, Have you bet more than you could really afford to lose?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= Almost always

ElementDescription: Thinking about the last 12 months, Still thinking about the last 12 months, have you needed to gamble with larger amounts of money to get the same feeling of excitement?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= Almost always

ElementDescription: Thinking about the last 12 months, When you gambled, did you go back another day to try to win back the money you lost?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= Almost always

ElementDescription: Thinking about the last 12 months, Have you borrowed money or sold anything to get money to gamble?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= Almost always

ElementDescription: Thinking about the last 12 months, Have you felt that you might have a problem with gambling?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= Almost always

ElementDescription: Thinking about the last 12 months, Has gambling caused you any health problems, including stress or anxiety?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= Almost always

ElementDescription: Thinking about the last 12 months, Have people criticized your betting or told you that you had a gambling problem, regardless of whether or not you thought it was true?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= Almost always

ElementDescription: Thinking about the last 12 months, Has your gambling caused any financial problems for you or your household?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= Almost always

ElementDescription: Thinking about the last 12 months, Have you felt guilty about the way you gamble or what happens when you gamble?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= Almost always

ElementDescription: Problem Gambling Severity Index (PGSI) Total Score
Notes: Sum of items: pgsi_gambled + pgsi_afford + pgsi_excitement + pgsi_anotherday + pgsi_borrowed + pgsi_problem + pgsi_health + pgsi_criticized + pgsi_financial + pgsi_guilty
